poem:
A Ripple in the Dark

A strike in Tehran,  
a leader silenced before dawn—  
echoes of blood and blame.  
In homes of dust,  
dreams fracture—  
shadows of men  
etched in sand, grieving.  
Grave escalation, tomb of words,  
peace unravels  
thread by thread.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Hamas blamed Israel for Haniyeh’s death, which one official described as a “grave escalation”. It said he was targeted at his residence in Tehran, after participating". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
